   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of diameter_tcp/sctp as implementations of the diameter
   23: %% transport interface.
   24: %%
   25: 
   26: -module(diameter_transport_SUITE).
   27: 
   28: %% all tests, no common_test dependency
   29: -export([run/0]).
   30: 
   31: %% common_test wrapping
   32: -export([
   33:          %% Framework functions
   34:          suite/0,
   35:          all/0,
   36:          init_per_suite/1,
   37:          end_per_suite/1,
   38:         
   39:          %% The test cases
   40:          parallel/1
   41:         ]).
   42: 
   43: -export([accept/1,
   44:          connect/1,
   45:          reconnect/1,
   46:          init/2]).
   47: 
   48: -include_lib("kernel/include/inet_sctp.hrl").
   49: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   50: 
   51: -include("diameter_util.hrl").
   52: 
   53: %% Corresponding to diameter_* transport modules.
   54: -define(TRANSPORTS, [tcp, sctp]).
   55: 
   56: %% Receive a message.
   57: -define(RECV(Pat, Ret), receive Pat -> Ret end).
   58: -define(RECV(Pat), ?RECV(Pat, diameter_lib:now())).
   59: 
   60: %% Sockets are opened on the loopback address.
   61: -define(ADDR, {127,0,0,1}).
   62: 
   63: %% diameter_tcp doesn't use anything but host_ip_address, and that
   64: %% only is a local address isn't configured as at transport start.
   65: -define(SVC(Addrs), #diameter_service{capabilities
   66:                                       = #diameter_caps{host_ip_address
   67:                                                        = Addrs}}).
   68: 
   69: %% The term we register after open a listening port with gen_{tcp,sctp}.
   70: -define(TEST_LISTENER(Ref, PortNr),
   71:         {?MODULE, listen, Ref, PortNr}).
   72: 
   73: %% Message over the transport interface.
   74: -define(TMSG(T), {diameter, T}).
   75: 
   76: %% Options for gen_tcp/gen_sctp.
   77: -define(TCP_OPTS,  [binary, {active, true}, {packet, 0}]).
   78: -define(SCTP_OPTS, [binary, {active, true}, {sctp_initmsg, ?SCTP_INIT}]).
   79: 
   80: %% Request a specific number of streams just because we can.
   81: -define(SCTP_INIT, #sctp_initmsg{num_ostreams = 5,
   82:                                  max_instreams = 5}).
   83: 
   84: %% Messages from gen_sctp.
   85: -define(SCTP(Sock, Data), {sctp, Sock, _, _, Data}).
   86: 
   87: 
   88: -define(TL(F),    ?TL(F, [])).
   89: -define(TL(F, A), ?LOG("DTRANSPS", F, A)).
   90: 
   91: 
   92: %% ===========================================================================
   93: %% common_test wrapping
   94: 
   95: suite() ->
   96:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 270}}].
   97: 
   98: all() ->
   99:     [parallel].
  100: 
  101: 
  102: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  103:     ?DUTIL:init_per_suite(Config).
  104: 
  105: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  106:     ?DUTIL:end_per_suite(Config).
  107: 
  108: 
  109: parallel(_) ->
  110:     ?TL("parallel -> entry"),
  111:     Res = run(),
  112:     ?TL("parallel -> done when"
  113:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  114:     Res.
  115: 
  116: 
  117: %% ===========================================================================
  118: 
  119: %% run/0
  120: 
  121: run() ->
  122:     ok = diameter:start(),
  123:     try
  124:         ?RUN([[fun run/1, {P,F}]
  125:               || P <- [sctp || ?HAVE_SCTP()] ++ [tcp],
  126:                  F <- [connect, accept, reconnect]])
  127:     after
  128:         diameter:stop()
  129:     end.
  130: 
  131: %% run/1
  132: 
  133: run({Prot, reconnect}) ->
  134:     ?TL("run(reconnect) -> entry with"
  135:         "~n   Prot: ~p", [Prot]),
  136:     Res = reconnect(Prot),
  137:     ?TL("run(reconnect) -> done when"
  138:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  139:     Res;
  140: 
  141: run({Prot, accept}) ->
  142:     ?TL("run(accept) -> entry with"
  143:         "~n   Prot: ~p", [Prot]),
  144:     Res = accept(Prot),
  145:     ?TL("run(accept) -> done when"
  146:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  147:     Res;
  148: 
  149: run({Prot, connect}) ->
  150:     ?TL("run(connect) -> entry with"
  151:         "~n   Prot: ~p", [Prot]),
  152:     Res = connect(Prot),
  153:     ?TL("run(connect) -> done when"
  154:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  155:     Res.
  156: 
  157: 
  158: %% ===========================================================================
  159: %% accept/1
  160: %%
  161: %% diameter transport accepting, test code connecting.
  162: 
  163: accept(Prot) ->
  164:     ?TL("accept -> entry with"
  165:         "~n   Prot: ~p", [Prot]),
  166: 
  167:     Ref = make_ref(),
  168:     true = diameter_reg:add_new({diameter_config, transport, Ref}), %% fake it
  169:     T = {Prot, Ref},
  170:     Res = ?RUN([{{?MODULE, [init, X, T]}, 15000}
  171:                 || X <- [accept, gen_connect]]),
  172: 
  173:     ?TL("accept -> done when"
  174:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  175:     ok.
  176: 
  177: 
  178: %% ===========================================================================
  179: %% connect/1
  180: %%
  181: %% Test code accepting, diameter transport connecting.
  182: 
  183: connect(Prot) ->
  184:     ?TL("connect -> entry with"
  185:         "~n   Prot: ~p", [Prot]),
  186: 
  187:     T = {Prot, make_ref()},
  188:     Res = ?RUN([{{?MODULE, [init, X, T]}, 15000}
  189:                  || X <- [gen_accept, connect]]),
  190: 
  191:     ?TL("connect -> done when"
  192:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  193:     ok.
  194: 
  195: 
  196: %% ===========================================================================
  197: %% reconnect/1
  198: %%
  199: %% Exercise reconnection behaviour: that a connecting transport
  200: %% doesn't try to establish a new connection until the old one is
  201: %% broken.
  202: 
  203: reconnect({listen, Ref}) ->
  204:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> entry with"
  205:         "~n   Ref: ~p", [Ref]),
  206:     SvcName = make_ref(),
  207:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> start service (~p)", [SvcName]),
  208:     ok = start_service(SvcName),
  209:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> connect"),
  210:     LRef = ?LISTEN(SvcName, tcp, [{watchdog_timer, 6000}]),
  211:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> wait"),
  212:     [_] = diameter_reg:wait({diameter_tcp, listener, {LRef, '_'}}),
  213:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> register new transport"),
  214:     true = diameter_reg:add_new({?MODULE, Ref, LRef}),
  215: 
  216:     %% Wait for partner to request transport death.
  217:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> abort: await (request for) transport death"),
  218:     TPid = abort(SvcName, LRef, Ref),
  219: 
  220:     %% Kill transport to force the peer to reconnect.
  221:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> kill transport"),
  222:     exit(TPid, kill),
  223: 
  224:     %% Wait for the partner again.
  225:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> abort: wait for partner again"),
  226:     Res = abort(SvcName, LRef, Ref),
  227: 
  228:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> done when"
  229:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  230:     ok;
  231: 
  232: reconnect({connect, Ref}) ->
  233:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> entry with"
  234:         "~n   Ref: ~p", [Ref]),
  235: 
  236:     SvcName = make_ref(),
  237:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> subscribe"),
  238:     true = diameter:subscribe(SvcName),
  239:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> start service (~p)", [SvcName]),
  240:     ok = start_service(SvcName),
  241:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> wait"),
  242:     [{{_, _, LRef}, Pid}] = diameter_reg:wait({?MODULE, Ref, '_'}),
  243:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> connect"),
  244:     CRef = ?CONNECT(SvcName, tcp, LRef, [{connect_timer, 2000},
  245:                                          {watchdog_timer, 6000}]),
  246: 
  247:     %% Tell partner to kill transport after seeing that there are no
  248:     %% reconnection attempts.
  249:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> abort (kill transport)"),
  250:     abort(SvcName, Pid, Ref),
  251: 
  252:     %% Transport goes down and is reestablished.
  253:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> await transport down"),
  254:     ?RECV(#diameter_event{service = SvcName, info = {down, CRef, _, _}}),
  255:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> await transport reconnect"),
  256:     ?RECV(#diameter_event{service = SvcName, info = {reconnect, CRef, _}}),
  257:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> await transport up"),
  258:     ?RECV(#diameter_event{service = SvcName, info = {up, CRef, _, _, _}}),
  259: 
  260:     %% Kill again.
  261:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> abort (kill transport again)"),
  262:     abort(SvcName, Pid, Ref),
  263: 
  264:     %% Wait for partner to die.
  265:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> await partner death"),
  266:     MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
  267:     Res = ?RECV({'DOWN', MRef, process, _, _}),
  268: 
  269:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> done when"
  270:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  271:     ok;
  272: 
  273: reconnect(Prot) ->
  274:     ?TL("reconnect -> entry with"
  275:         "~n   Prot: ~p", [Prot]),
  276:     Ref = make_ref(),
  277:     Res = ?RUN([{{?MODULE, [reconnect, {T, Ref}]}, 240000}
  278:                 || Prot == tcp,  %% ignore sctp
  279:                    T <- [listen, connect]]),
  280: 
  281:     ?TL("reconnect -> done when"
  282:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  283:     ok.
  284: 
  285: start_service(SvcName) ->
  286:     OH = diameter_util:unique_string(),
  287:     Opts = [{application, [{dictionary, diameter_gen_base_rfc6733},
  288:                            {module, diameter_callback}]},
  289:             {'Origin-Host', OH},
  290:             {'Origin-Realm', OH ++ ".org"},
  291:             {'Vendor-Id', 0},
  292:             {'Product-Name', "x"},
  293:             {'Auth-Application-Id', [0]}],
  294:     diameter:start_service(SvcName, Opts).
  295: 
  296: abort(SvcName, Pid, Ref)
  297:   when is_pid(Pid) ->
  298:     receive
  299:         #diameter_event{service = SvcName, info = {reconnect, _, _}} = E ->
  300:             erlang:error(E)
  301:     after 45000 ->
  302:             ok
  303:     end,
  304:     Pid ! {abort, Ref};
  305: 
  306: abort(SvcName, LRef, Ref)
  307:   when is_reference(LRef) ->
  308:     ?RECV({abort, Ref}),
  309:     [[{ref, LRef}, {type, listen}, {options, _}, {accept, [_,_] = Ts} | _]]
  310:                                                  %% assert on two accepting
  311:         = diameter:service_info(SvcName, transport),
  312:     [TPid] = [P || [{watchdog, {_,_,okay}}, {peer, {P,_}} | _] <- Ts],
  313:     TPid.
  314: 
  315: %% ===========================================================================
  316: %% ===========================================================================
  317: 
  318: %% init/2
  319: 
  320: init(accept, {Prot, Ref}) ->
  321:     ?TL("init(accept) -> entry with"
  322:         "~n   Prot: ~p"
  323:         "~n   Ref:  ~p", [Prot, Ref]),
  324: 
  325:     %% Start an accepting transport and receive notification of a
  326:     %% connection.
  327:     TPid = start_accept(Prot, Ref),
  328: 
  329:     %% Receive a message and send it back.
  330:     <<_:8, Len:24, _/binary>> = Bin = bin(Prot, ?RECV(?TMSG({recv, P}), P)),
  331: 
  332:     Len = size(Bin),
  333:     TPid ! ?TMSG({send, Bin}),
  334: 
  335:     %% Expect the transport process to die as a result of the peer
  336:     %% closing the connection.
  337:     MRef = erlang:monitor(process, TPid),
  338:     Res = ?RECV({'DOWN', MRef, process, _, _}),
  339: 
  340:     ?TL("init(accept) -> done when"
  341:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  342:     ok;
  343: 
  344: init(gen_connect, {Prot, Ref}) ->
  345:     ?TL("init(gen_connect) -> entry with"
  346:         "~n   Prot: ~p"
  347:         "~n   Ref:  ~p", [Prot, Ref]),
  348: 
  349:     %% Lookup the peer's listening socket.
  350:     [PortNr] = ?LPORT(Prot, Ref),
  351: 
  352:     %% Connect, send a message and receive it back.
  353:     {ok, Sock} = gen_connect(Prot, PortNr),
  354:     Bin = make_msg(),
  355:     ok = gen_send(Prot, Sock, Bin),
  356:     Bin = gen_recv(Prot, Sock),
  357: 
  358:     ?TL("init(gen_connect) -> done"),
  359:     ok;
  360: 
  361: init(gen_accept, {Prot, Ref}) ->
  362:     ?TL("init(gen_accept) -> entry with"
  363:         "~n   Prot: ~p"
  364:         "~n   Ref:  ~p", [Prot, Ref]),
  365: 
  366:     %% Open a listening socket and publish the port number.
  367:     {ok, LSock} = gen_listen(Prot),
  368:     {ok, PortNr} = inet:port(LSock),
  369:     true = diameter_reg:add_new(?TEST_LISTENER(Ref, PortNr)),
  370: 
  371:     %% Accept a connection, receive a message send it back, and wait
  372:     %% for the peer to close the connection.
  373:     {ok, Sock} = gen_accept(Prot, LSock),
  374:     Bin = gen_recv(Prot, Sock),
  375:     ok = gen_send(Prot, Sock, Bin),
  376:     _Res = receive
  377:                {tcp_closed, Sock} = T ->
  378:                    T;
  379:                ?SCTP(Sock, {_, #sctp_assoc_change{}}) = T ->
  380:                    T
  381:            end,
  382: 
  383:     ?TL("init(gen_accept) -> done when"
  384:         "~n   Res: ~p", [_Res]),
  385:     ok;
  386: 
  387: init(connect, {Prot, Ref}) ->
  388:     ?TL("init(connect) -> entry with"
  389:         "~n   Prot: ~p"
  390:         "~n   Ref:  ~p", [Prot, Ref]),
  391: 
  392:     %% Lookup the peer's listening socket.
  393:     [{?TEST_LISTENER(_, PortNr), _}]
  394:         = diameter_reg:wait(?TEST_LISTENER(Ref, '_')),
  395: 
  396:     %% Start a connecting transport and receive notification of
  397:     %% the connection.
  398:     TPid = start_connect(Prot, PortNr, Ref),
  399: 
  400:     %% Send a message and receive it back.
  401:     Bin = make_msg(),
  402:     TPid ! ?TMSG({send, Bin}),
  403:     Bin = bin(Prot, ?RECV(?TMSG({recv, P}), P)),
  404: 
  405:     ?TL("init(connect) -> done"),
  406:     ok.
  407: 
  408: bin(sctp, #diameter_packet{bin = Bin}) ->
  409:     Bin;
  410: bin(tcp, Bin) ->
  411:     Bin.
  412: 
  413: %% make_msg/0
  414: %%
  415: %% A valid Diameter message in as far as diameter_tcp examines it,
  416: %% the module examining the length in the Diameter header to locate
  417: %% message boundaries.
  418: 
  419: make_msg() ->
  420:     N = 1024,
  421:     Bin = rand_bytes(4*N),
  422:     Len = 4*(N+1),
  423:     <<1:8, Len:24, Bin/binary>>.
  424: 
  425: %% crypto:rand_bytes/1 isn't available on all platforms (since openssl
  426: %% isn't) so roll our own. Not particularly random, but less verbose
  427: %% in trace.
  428: rand_bytes(N) ->
  429:     Oct = rand:uniform(256) - 1,
  430:     binary:copy(<<Oct>>, N).
  431: 
  432: %% ===========================================================================
  433: 
  434: %% start_connect/3
  435: 
  436: start_connect(Prot, PortNr, Ref) ->
  437:     {ok, TPid} = start_connect(Prot,
  438:                                {connect, Ref},
  439:                                ?SVC([]),
  440:                                [{raddr, ?ADDR},
  441:                                 {rport, PortNr},
  442:                                 {ip, ?ADDR},
  443:                                 {port, 0}]),
  444:     connected(Prot, TPid),
  445:     TPid.
  446: 
  447: connected(sctp, TPid) ->
  448:     ?RECV(?TMSG({TPid, connected, _}));
  449: connected(tcp, TPid) ->
  450:     ?RECV(?TMSG({TPid, connected, _, [?ADDR]})).
  451: 
  452: start_connect(sctp, T, Svc, Opts) ->
  453:     {ok, TPid, [?ADDR]}
  454:         = diameter_sctp:start(T, Svc, [{sctp_initmsg, ?SCTP_INIT} | Opts]),
  455:     {ok, TPid};
  456: start_connect(tcp, T, Svc, Opts) ->
  457:     diameter_tcp:start(T, Svc, Opts).
  458: 
  459: %% start_accept/2
  460: 
  461: start_accept(Prot, Ref) ->
  462:     {ok, TPid, [?ADDR]}
  463:         = start_accept(Prot, {accept, Ref}, ?SVC([?ADDR]), [{port, 0}]),
  464:     ?RECV(?TMSG({TPid, connected})),
  465:     TPid.
  466: 
  467: start_accept(sctp, T, Svc, Opts) ->
  468:     diameter_sctp:start(T, Svc, [{sctp_initmsg, ?SCTP_INIT} | Opts]);
  469: start_accept(tcp, T, Svc, Opts) ->
  470:     diameter_tcp:start(T, Svc, Opts).
  471: 
  472: %% ===========================================================================
  473: 
  474: %% gen_connect/2
  475: 
  476: gen_connect(sctp = P, PortNr) ->
  477:     {ok, Sock} = Ok = gen_sctp:open([{ip, ?ADDR}, {port, 0} | ?SCTP_OPTS]),
  478:     ok = gen_sctp:connect_init(Sock, ?ADDR, PortNr, []),
  479:     Ok = gen_accept(P, Sock);
  480: gen_connect(tcp, PortNr) ->
  481:     gen_tcp:connect(?ADDR, PortNr, ?TCP_OPTS).
  482: 
  483: %% gen_listen/1
  484: 
  485: gen_listen(sctp) ->
  486:     {ok, Sock} = gen_sctp:open([{ip, ?ADDR}, {port, 0} | ?SCTP_OPTS]),
  487:     {gen_sctp:listen(Sock, true), Sock};
  488: gen_listen(tcp) ->
  489:     gen_tcp:listen(0, [{ip, ?ADDR} | ?TCP_OPTS]).
  490: 
  491: %% gen_accept/2
  492: 
  493: gen_accept(sctp, Sock) ->
  494:     #sctp_assoc_change{state = comm_up,
  495:                        outbound_streams = OS,
  496:                        inbound_streams = IS,
  497:                        assoc_id = Id}
  498:         = ?RECV(?SCTP(Sock, {_, #sctp_assoc_change{} = S}), S),
  499: 
  500:     putr(assoc, {OS, IS, Id}),
  501:     {ok, Sock};
  502: gen_accept(tcp, LSock) ->
  503:     gen_tcp:accept(LSock).
  504: 
  505: %% gen_send/3
  506: 
  507: gen_send(sctp, Sock, Bin) ->
  508:     {OS, _IS, Id} = getr(assoc),
  509:     gen_sctp:send(Sock, Id, erlang:unique_integer([positive]) rem OS, Bin);
  510: gen_send(tcp, Sock, Bin) ->
  511:     gen_tcp:send(Sock, Bin).
  512: 
  513: %% gen_recv/2
  514: 
  515: gen_recv(sctp, Sock) ->
  516:     {OS, IS, Id} = getr(assoc),
  517:     receive
  518:         ?SCTP(Sock, {[#sctp_sndrcvinfo{assoc_id = I} = INFO], Bin})
  519:           when is_binary(Bin) ->
  520:             case {I, Id} of
  521:                 {Id, _} -> % assert
  522:                     Bin;
  523:                 _ ->
  524:                     ?TL("unexpected assoc id in received info msg:"
  525:                         "~n   Expected Assoc ID: ~p"
  526:                         "~n      OS: ~p"
  527:                         "~n      IS: ~p"
  528:                         "~n   Received Assoc ID: ~p"
  529:                         "~n   Info:              ~p", [Id, OS, IS, I, INFO]),
  530:                     ct:fail({unexpected_assoc_id, I, Id})
  531:             end
  532:     end;
  533: gen_recv(tcp, Sock) ->
  534:     tcp_recv(Sock, <<>>).
  535: 
  536: tcp_recv(_, <<_:8, Len:24, _/binary>> = Bin)
  537:   when Len =< size(Bin) ->
  538:     Bin;
  539: tcp_recv(Sock, B) ->
  540:     receive {tcp, Sock, Bin} -> tcp_recv(Sock, <<B/binary, Bin/binary>>) end.
  541: 
  542: %% putr/2
  543: 
  544: putr(Key, Val) ->
  545:     put({?MODULE, Key}, Val).
  546: 
  547: %% getr/1
  548: 
  549: getr(Key) ->
  550:     get({?MODULE, Key}).
